text: Good morning. Hey.
Where are the pancakes?
What pancakes?
You always make pancakes on Saturday morning.
I make them for Jake. Jake's not here.
Kind of weird without him, huh?
Yes. Would it lift your spirits if you made pancakes for me?
I'm sorry, man.
I told you to blame it all on me.
Charlie, They had moved way past blame.
It was more like a jihad.
Except with no cookies.
Big mistake was dealing with them as a group.
The trick with women is to split them off from the herd one by one.
Otherwise, they spook and you risk a stampede.
Kind of like Buffalo.
In fact, I'll bet that's where that song comes from.
Buffalo Gals, won't you come out tonight?
Come out tonight. Do you hear yourself?
Buffalo Gals.
Are you insane?
This is the kind of talk that started this whole mess.
I didn't write the song, Allen.
Judith, can we talk about this?
There's nothing to talk about, Charlie.
Okay, don't.
Talk. Just listen.
I love Jake and I would never intentionally do anything to influence him in a

I don't care about your intentions.
Okay? I'm a jerk.
I'm immature. I'm self-centered.
I'm. Hi, I'm Charlie.
Yes, we've heard about you.
And I'll bet none of it's good.
I'm sorry. What is your name?
Linda. Linda.
Really? I once had my heart broken by a woman named Linda.
Charlie, we're having a meeting.
And I'll bet it was about me.
Am I right? Come on.
Be honest.
Mandy.
Mandy. I love that song.
Mandy. Charlie, listen.
I know I can't come in here and ask to be forgiven for some of the stupid

But I do have the right to say I'm sorry, don't I?
I suppose.
Thank you. And you are?
Kathleen.
Kathleen. A fine Irish name.

Yeah, I guess.
I envy that. Kathleen.
Me and my

We're not a bunch of sorority girls you can charm with your big brown eyes.
And nice smile.

that probably go back to my mom.
My mother crippled me emotionally.
You too.
And I am so afraid I'm making the same mistakes.
With my daughter.
Well, you know what, Ruth?
Ruth? That's the same fear I had with Jake.
Ruth. I've clearly made mistakes, but that's because I'm human.
And after all, what are we trying to do with our children other than to raise

Oh, stop it, Charlie.
Our children. You have no children.
That's true. Although I don't think it's fair to throw it in my face.
I mean, some of us haven't been blessed with the little ones the way you have.

Look, I'm being real upfront with you about the mistakes I've made with Jake,

But let's talk for a minute about how he's influenced me, how this little boy
has made me.
A better man.
Oh.
Oh, dear God. You're not going to listen to this crap, are you?
No, I will not. Shush.
He's lying to you.
That's all he does.
Lie, lie, lie. You've got to believe me.
It's okay. It's all right, Judith.
We're all here for you.
